abstract: Shares on Wall Street skidded on Tuesday in a fitful day of trading amid signals that the economic downturn was lashing well-known American brands from Liz Claiborne to Starbucks to T. J. Maxx, The New York Times’s Jack Healy reported.
lead_paragraph: Shares on Wall Street skidded on Tuesday in a fitful day of trading amid signals that the economic downturn was lashing well-known American brands from Liz Claiborne to Starbucks to T. J. Maxx, The New York Times’s Jack Healy reported.

headline.main: Retail Worries Help Push Markets Lower
